result.execSummary:
The defendant John Charles Knox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $5,338.48 to Kenneth W.  $1,000.00 paid today from defense Atty.'s trust funds.  To be paid by 10/9/2020 or civil judgment shall be entered.  State has up to 60 days to file any amendments to the restitution.

Pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Court waiving other costs because restitution needs to be paid..
DNA SURCHARGE AND RESTITUTION to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 10/9/2020.  Nonpayment shal be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Notify Department of Justice and return his CCW permit.
Pay restitution to the victim Kenneth W. if selling home, money to be used to pay restitution.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Charles Knox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Concerning Sentence Adjustment pursuant to 973.195 WI Stat.,signed and filed.

The Court orders: 
The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest. 

Copy of ordered forwarded to the State and the Defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs

Certification of transcript of proceedings of ADJOURNMENT commencing MAY 7, 2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to DENNIS THORNTON  230 W. WELLS STREET #405   MILWAUKEE, WI 53203

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
All parties in receipt of PSI reports. 

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statment by Kenneth W, Cecilia K..
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for SIX  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of TWO YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of FOUR YEARS, concurrent  to any other sentence, credit for 2 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance program. 
-Restitution set at $5338.48 to the victim Kenneth W.  by stipulation of the parties. $1000.00 paid today from defense atty. trust funds.State has up to 60 days to file any amendments to the restitution.PAY restitution by 10-09-2020 or civil judgment shall be entered.
-Court costs AND FEES ARE WAIVED, BUT NOT THE DNA surcharge and restitution   which is to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by  10-9-2020   ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Court waiving costs because restituion needs to be paid. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 10-09-2020      ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*notify department of Justice and return his CCW permit. 
*pay restitution  to the victim Kenneth W. , if selling home money to be used to pay restitution. 
-No contact with KENNETH W. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

TO THE ORIGINAL CHARGE:

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. No voting until civil rights are restored.

Defense request for a psI is granted by the court.  CAse is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-09-2014 at 01:30 pm.
State filed witness list; jury instructions; motion in limine. lr

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn the jury trial is denied by the court.   Court ordered case to remain on for jury trial in Branch
47.

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/11/2014 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 8/27/2014 at 9:00 am. 
  Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison M Ritter. Randy Sitzberger for Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs time to review discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/30/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Denis Stingl for Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kenneth W.

Defendant John Charles Knox in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant John Charles Knox in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for John Charles Knox

Prior: 5835 West Hustis Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
